secText: We can also write an equation that relates the wavelength of the light to measurements from a double-slit interference experiment with light waves.  The measurements are of the distance between the slits’ midpoints, the distance from the central bright band to the first bright band, and the distance to the screen.

The equation shows us how to design an experiment to measure the wavelength of light, which is very small.  The three distances can be measured, and the wavelength of a particular color of light can then be calculated.
